meanings.definition: In a manner intended to defend or protect oneself or something.
meanings.sent1: She stood defensively, ready to protect herself from any harm.
meanings.sent2: The soldier acted defensively, shielding his comrades from danger.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed defensively as if warning the dog not to come closer.
meanings.sent4: The mother bird chirped defensively, guarding her nest from intruders.
meanings.sent5: The goalkeeper dived defensively to block the incoming ball.

meanings.definition: Showing a defensive attitude or behavior.
meanings.sent1: His defensively crossed arms indicated his reluctance to engage in the conversation.
meanings.sent2: The student's defensively tone suggested he felt attacked by the teacher's question.
meanings.sent3: The cat's defensively arched back made it look bigger than it actually was.
meanings.sent4: The fortress stood defensively on the hill, ready to repel any invaders.
meanings.sent5: The child's defensively puffed cheeks showed his defiance towards his parents.

meanings.sent1: The defensively designed walls of the castle were impenetrable.
meanings.sent2: The team's defensively strategy focused on protecting their goal at all costs.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's defensively built nest was hidden high up in the tree.
meanings.sent4: The country invested in defensively technologies to safeguard its borders.
meanings.sent5: The house had a defensively reinforced door to prevent break-ins.
